title: Horses take centre stage at Pushkar fair this year with sales totalling Rs 75 lakh
description: The Pushkar annual cattle fair witnessed a significant shift this year as Marwadi and Kathiawadi horse sales overshadowed traditional bovine trade. Horses and camels are increasingly being purchased for transportation purposes in rural areas, with bulls seeing a sharp decline in sales due to modern farming equipment. The highest horse sale recorded was Rs 4.

'Intentional' explosion hits Harvard Medical School; police release suspects' photos
description: An early Saturday morning explosion at Harvard Medical School's Goldenson Building has been deemed 'intentional' by authorities. A police officer observed two masked individuals fleeing the scene just before the blast. While no injuries were reported, investigators are seeking public assistance to identify the suspects captured in released photos. The FBI is also involved in the ongoing investigation.

title: Shreyas Iyer injury update: Why he chose to stay back in Sydney - Inside story

He will remain in Sydney for follow-up care for the next seven to ten days, prioritising his complete well-being over an immediate return to cricket.

description: A devastating stampede at a new Srikakulam temple claimed nine lives, including eight women and a boy, and injured over 25 during Karthika Ekadashi. A railing collapse on a crowded staircase triggered the panic. Authorities are investigating the lack of prior approval, poor crowd control, and inadequate security at the privately run shrine.

title: Bold prediction! 'One-in-a-billion horoscope': Harmanpreet will lift Women's WC trophy
description: Scientific astrologer Greenstone Lobo predicts a 90% chance for India to win the 2025 Women's World Cup against South Africa. He cites captain Harmanpreet Kaur's 'one-in-a-billion horoscope' and the team's 'Grey Lizards' as key factors. Despite South Africa's strong skipper Laura Wolvaardt, Lobo believes India's stars are aligned for a historic triumph.

The government allocated significant funds for these initiatives.

3 everyday foods that can help you live longer, according to science
description: Eating whole grains, nuts, and fruits and vegetables can help you live longer. These foods are packed with nutrients that protect against heart disease and diabetes. They also help manage cholesterol and blood pressure. Making these simple food choices a regular part of your diet can significantly boost your health and lifespan.

title: Stephen Curry playing tonight vs Pacers? Warriors issue key injury update
description: Stephen Curry is set to lead the Golden State Warriors against the injury-plagued Indiana Pacers on November 1, 2025. Despite missing key players, Curry's MVP-caliber play fuels the Warriors' Western Conference success. The Pacers, without star Tyrese Haliburton, face a significant challenge, hoping to find resilience against the experienced Warriors squad.

title: Amid uptick of Christian nationalism, JD Vance-Usha marriage under scrutiny
description: Vice President JD Vance is facing divorce rumors after photos of him with Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika Kirk, went viral. Speculation intensified after Vance expressed hope his Hindu wife, Usha, would embrace Christianity, drawing criticism from Hindu groups and fueling far-right narratives about Christian nationalism ahead of a potential 2028 presidential run.

Former India U-19 cricketer Rajesh Banik dies in accident; Tripura cricket mourns
description: Former India U-19 cricketer Rajesh Banik tragically passed away in a road accident at 40. A talented all-rounder for Tripura, Banik represented the state in numerous first-class, List A, and T20 matches. He also served as a selector for the U-16 team, leaving a significant mark on Tripura's cricket. His untimely demise has deeply saddened the cricketing fraternity.

description: A viral post reveals the silent struggle of Indian professionals enduring toxic bosses. Financial needs, family care, and education force many to stay, despite emotional harassment. This situation highlights a hidden crisis where employees face severe stress and burnout. Companies champion wellness, but reality shows a gap. Speaking out is a crucial first step towards dignity.

KL Rahul was also an option discussed but that was shut down rather quickly. Kolkata Knight Riders, meanwhile, are also pushing for the India batter but without a feasible swappable player.

description: An opinion poll by JVC Poll on Times Now predicts the JD(U)-led NDA will retain power in Bihar, securing 120-140 seats in the 243-member assembly. Tejashwi Yadav leads the popularity chart for CM, while the NDA is projected to get 41-43% vote share. Elections are scheduled for November 6 and 11.

Ahead of the Women's World Cup final against South Africa, she emphasised the team's hard work and collective spirit. This marks India's third final appearance, and they are determined to make this a 'special day' for the nation.

description: The Indian women's cricket team is set to play South Africa in the ICC Women's ODI World Cup final. A victory could bring a historic win and a significant cash reward. The BCCI is considering a prize comparable to the men's team's earnings for the 2024 T20 World Cup triumph. This move aligns with the board's commitment to equal pay for male and female cricketers.

description: Misfits Boxing sees a major shake-up as KSI is out as CEO, replaced by Andrew Tate. Co-founder Mams Taylor cited KSI's inactivity as the reason, aiming for a more dynamic leadership. Tate's appointment has stirred controversy, with KSI expressing strong disapproval. The boxing promotion gears up for a significant event in Dubai under its new direction.

Jalen Hurts sparks mystery with cryptic ‘God’ costume at Eagles party
description: Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts embraced Halloween by dressing as Morgan Freeman's 'God' from the movie 'Bruce Almighty.'  Fans interpreted the costume as a nod to serving others and cleaning up the team's offensive struggles, with one fan humorously suggesting he was 'cleaning up Patullo's mess' due to the offense's ranking.

'RJD to bring back jungle raj': BJP attacks on Tejashwi; cites Shahabuddin's son's nomination
description: The BJP has accused the RJD of reviving "baahubal" politics by fielding Mohammad Shahabuddin's son, Osama Shahab, from Siwan's Raghunathpur seat. BJP president JP Nadda warned of a return to "jungle raj," contrasting it with the development under Nitish Kumar and PM Modi. Voters are urged to support the NDA for stability and accelerated development.

Same entry and exit points, crowd surge: What led to deadly Andhra temple stampede - 10 key points
description: A stampede at the Venkateswara Swami Temple in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam claimed at least 10 lives and injured several others as a large crowd gathered for Ekadashi. The privately managed temple, not registered with the state endowments department, lacked official approvals, contributing to the chaos. Injured devotees are receiving treatment, with authorities fearing a rise in the death toll.

NMC redefines faculty eligibility: New rules reshape teaching; clarity on appointments
description: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has issued detailed clarifications on the Medical Institutions (Qualifications of Faculty) Regulations, 2025, effective June 30. The FAQs outline eligibility norms for Senior Consultants, Professors, Associate Professors, and Assistant Professors, addressing experience criteria, transitional provisions, and equivalence across specialties to ensure uniform, transparent, and merit-based faculty recruitment nationwide.

title: Why in-house counsel can’t claim client attorney privilege under Section 132 of BSA: Supreme Court explains

Unprecedented brightening of interstellar Comet 3I/ATLAS reported in new research
Language row: Karnataka CM says English, Hindi hurting children’s talent
description: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah accused the central government of neglecting Kannada and imposing Hindi, stating the state receives a "paltry amount" in return for its significant revenue contribution. He called for opposition to "anti-Kannada" elements and advocated for laws to make the mother tongue the medium of instruction in education, arguing English and Hindi weaken children's talent.

title: Bill Gates' warning on AI: Tons of investments will be 'dead ends'
description: Microsoft founder Bill Gates warns many AI investments will fail. He compares the current AI boom to the dot-com era.  A study shows 95% of companies see no return on AI investments.  Most AI tools boost individual work but lack business impact.  Many fail due to workflow issues and poor integration.

title: Ekadashi rush: Stampede breaks out at Venkateswara Swami temple in Andhra; 9 killed
description: A tragic stampede at the Venkateswara Swami Temple in Kasibugga claimed the lives of five devotees and injured several others on Saturday morning. The incident occurred during Ekadashi, a sacred Hindu observance, as thousands of devotees gathered. Authorities reportedly struggled to manage the immense crowd, leading to the fatal crush.

title: 'My age may be young, but ... ': Tejashwi shares how he plans to fulfill govt job promise; slams NDA
description: Tejashwi Yadav, INDIA bloc's Bihar CM candidate, pledges to transform the state into a job creation hub, ending migration. He highlights plans for factories, educational institutions, and healthcare, contrasting them with the NDA's perceived lack of vision for Bihar. Yadav dismisses 'jungle raj' fears, emphasizing economic justice and inclusive development.

title: Mumbai hostage scare: Kids gagged, hands tied for hrs for 'scene’ shoot; witnesses recount horror
description: A chilling hostage drama unfolded in Mumbai when a web series shoot turned real. Children, believing they were filming a scene, were held captive for hours by the director, Rohit Aarrya, who threatened them with a gun and rod. Prepared with flammable materials, Aarrya's plan was revealed after he pulled out weapons, leading to a tense standoff and eventual rescue.

title: Jockey Tommie Jakes, 19, dies hours after final ride as racing world mourns
description: The horse racing community mourns jockey Tommie Jakes, 19, found dead at home. Jakes was a rising star, riding for top trainer George Boughey. He achieved his first win at 16. His sudden passing has sent shockwaves through the sport. Tributes pour in from jockeys and trainers. Police confirmed the death is not suspicious. A coroner's inquiry is underway.

title: Leon Draisaitl slams refs over Mika Zibanejad penalty in Oilers OT loss
description: Leon Draisaitl expressed frustration with a controversial officiating call that resulted in a minor penalty for a high stick, which he felt should have been a double minor. Despite the disputed call, Draisaitl also acknowledged the Oilers' own issues with turnovers and puck management contributing to their overtime loss to the Rangers.

title: How much farting is normal per day? Top nutrition coach reveals 'healthy' number
description: Passing gas is natural, with 10 to 20 times daily considered normal. Exceeding this may signal digestive problems or dietary imbalances. Foods like beans and cruciferous vegetables, along with stress and certain medications, can increase gas. Eating slowly, staying hydrated, and exercising can help manage excess gas. Too little gas can also indicate issues with gut movement or enzyme activity, according to Ryan Fernando.
